result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie Marie Garcia

records.addlTxt:
4:52 PM Defendant Stephanie Marie Garcia appeared by video.  Attorney William Andrew Mayer appeared by video for Stephanie Marie Garcia.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. No signed bond yet in case. Atty Mayer states client still in rehabilitation from COVID and COVID related issued, signed up at Samaritan's Hand, requests 60 days. Deft states she was on SCRAM bracelet but now able to blow into other device. State wants bond signed soon. Court reminds deft to comply with day reporting on time.
Status conference scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 04:30 pm.
Status conference on January 3, 2023 at 04:30 pm.
Day report dated 11-3-22

UNSIGNED
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions:
  Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.
  Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional.
  Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription.
  Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
  Not operate any motor vehicles unless reinstated according to law.
  Comply with day reporting requirements: SOB or SCRAM bracelet at the discretion of Day Reporting staff.
Instructions on How to Appear Remotely by Zoom for the week of October 31, 2022 (criminal block time)

2:40 PM Defendant Stephanie Marie Garcia appeared by video.  Attorney William Andrew Mayer appeared by video for Stephanie Marie Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Wassink from Day Reporting by video. Officer Wassink ordered a SCRAM bracelet yesterday for the defendant. Court modifies the bond to allow Day Reporting have discretion as to SCRAM or Sober link device. No victim's. State does not object to bond modification.
Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 04:30 pm.
Status conference on November 3, 2022 at 04:30 pm.

Bail/bond hearing on September 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:05 AM Defendant Stephanie Marie Garcia appeared by video.  Attorney William Andrew Mayer appeared by video for Stephanie Marie Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deft waives right to in person appearance. Court is amending pre-lim questionnaire form that Deft is taking prescription medications. Probable cause found, Deft bound over. Defense rcvd' info waives reading, entered NG plea, Information only contains CT 1, blood draw not included, requests more time for a hearing. Court amends bond conditions to add not to operate motor vehicle unless reinstated by Law. Off record- 9:30 waiting for Day reporting to call in. Case recalled at 9:37 unable to reach Day reporting. Court holds off on amending bond until hearing Tomorrow, will address.
Instructions on How to Appear Remotely by Zoom for the week of August 29, 2022 (criminal block time)

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Mayer is appointed as counsel.

The first payment shall be made on July 1, 2022.  $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
